meanings.definition: The cost required for something; the money spent on something.
meanings.sent1: The expensed for the new equipment was high.
meanings.sent2: We need to keep track of our expensed to stay within budget.
meanings.sent3: The expensed for the party decorations added up quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her expensed for the vacation was like a small fortune.
meanings.sent5: The expensed for the repairs was more than expected.

meanings.definition: To treat something as an expense; to charge or write off as an expense.
meanings.sent1: She expensed the business trip to the company.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to expense all necessary items on your trip.
meanings.sent3: He expensed his lunch as a business meeting.
meanings.sent4: The company expensed the team-building event to improve morale.
meanings.sent5: Remember to expense any work-related purchases for reimbursement.
